Column Comment.0: ACQUISITION DESIGN ID: Unique identifier for the acquisition design
Column Comment.1: ACQUISITION COMPLETED DATE: The date on which acquisition was completed,in DATE format. A flexible varchar format is also provided.
Column Comment.2: COMPLETION DATE DESCRIPTION: Completion date of seismic shooting asyyyymm(DD) day optional. An alternate format in DATE format is also provided.
Column Comment.3: DIMENSION: The dimension or geometry of the seismic data. Mmay be 1D, 2D, 3D,swath, 3D water bottom
Column Comment.4: DIRECTION: a set of valid compass directions, used for referencing positionalinformation. For example, N, S, NE etc.
Column Comment.5: PLANNED ACQUISITION BIN SIZE: the inline bin size that was planned for duringacquisition
Column Comment.6: BIN SIZE ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: Note that the INLINE and the XLINE binsize units of measure must be in the same units.
Column Comment.7: ACQUISITION SET REMARK:comments about the seismic acquisition
Column Comment.8: SHOT POINT INTERVAL: Nominal interval between shot or vibrator points
Column Comment.9: ACQUISITION SHOT POINT INTERVAL ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: Theunits of measure used during initial data acquisition. Usually feet, meters.
Column Comment.10: SHOT LINE SPACING: Nominal spacing of shot lines
Column Comment.11: SHOT LINE SPACING ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure usedduring initial data acquisition.
Column Comment.12: ACQUISITION SHOT TIME INTERVAL: The interval in time between shots, usuallyon a marine vessel where shots are made every few seconds.
Column Comment.13: ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The orginal units of measure for the value column.
Column Comment.14: ACQUISITION START DATE: A DATE format field for the start date of acquisition.
Column Comment.15: START DATE DESCRIPTION: Date on which acquisition commenced asyyyymm(dd) day optional. A DATE format field is also provided
Column Comment.16: PLANNED ACQUISITION BIN SIZE: the xline bin size that was planned for duringacquisition
Column Comment.17: BIN SIZE ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: Note that the INLINE and the XLINE binsize units of measure must be in the same units.
Column Comment.18: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.19: ACTUAL INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether the design captured is the actualdesign for the seis set it is associated with, or a nominal design. In the first case, thisflag is set to Y and NOMINAL IND is set to N.
Column Comment.20: CDP COVERAGE: Common Depth Point nominal subsurface coverage (600%, 1200% etc.)
Column Comment.21: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.22: CHARGE SIZE: Charge size of dynamite charges used per shot for land or marine
Column Comment.23: CHARGE SIZE ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure used duringinitial data acquisition.
Column Comment.25: OPERATING PRESSURE ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measureused during initial data acquisition.
Column Comment.26: OPERATING VOLUME: operating volume to which each airgun is set
Column Comment.27: OPERATING VOLUME ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measureused during initial data acquisition.
Column Comment.28: AVERAGE SHOT DEPTH: Average shot depth of energy source
Column Comment.29: AVERAGE SHOT DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measureused during initial data acquisition.
Column Comment.30: SOURCE ARRAY SPACING: dist between multiple energy sources in a single array.
Column Comment.31: SOURCE ARRAY SPACING ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units ofmeasure used during initial data acquisition.
Column Comment.32: SOURCE ARRAY TYPE: linear, circular, star
Column Comment.33: SEISMIC SOURCE INSTRUMENTS MAKE: make and model of the equipment used.
Column Comment.34: SOURCES PER SHOT: Number of seperate energy sources in a multiple sourcearray
Column Comment.35: SWEEP DURATION: Duration of the vibroseis sweep, in seconds
Column Comment.36: ENERGY SWEEP DURATION ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units ofmeasure used during initial data acquisition, usually seconds
Column Comment.37: SWEEP END FREQUENCY: ending frequency of the vibroseis sweep
Column Comment.38: SWEEP FREQUENCY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure usedduring initial data acquisition, usually Hz
Column Comment.39: SWEEP MOVEUP DISTANCE: distance vibrators move up between each series ofsweeps
Column Comment.40: SWEEP MOVEUP DISTANCE ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units ofmeasure used during initial data acquisition.
Column Comment.41: SWEEP NUMBER: Number of sweeps at each energy source location
Column Comment.42: SWEEP START FREQUENCY: starting frequency of the vibroseis sweep
Column Comment.43: SWEEP TAPER: Decline time between zero energy and maximum force for vibsweep
Column Comment.44: SWEEP TAPER ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure usedduring initial data acquisition, usually milliseconds
Column Comment.45: SWEEP TYPE: May be linear, variable
Column Comment.46: SEISMIC ENERGY TYPE: unique ID for energy used, dynamite, airgun, vibroseis
Column Comment.47: ENVIRONMENT TYPE: in which seismic was collected (marine, land, transition)
Column Comment.48: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.49: MONITOR DEPTH: Measured depth to the downhole monitor which records theseismic energy. The depths are in reference to below mean sea level.
Column Comment.51: NOMINAL INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether the design captured is thenominal design for the seis set it is associated with, or an actual design. In the firstcase, this flag is set to Y and ACTUAL IND is set to N.
Column Comment.52: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.53: CHANNEL COUNT: Number of recording channels used
Column Comment.54: RECORDING FORMAT TYPE: May be analog, SEG B, SEG Y etc
Column Comment.55: GAIN MODE: Description of the amplification method used (AGC, IFP etc)
Column Comment.56: HIGH FILTER FREQUENCY: setting of instrument in HZ
Column Comment.57: HIGH FREQUENCY SLOPE: Attenuation rate of high frequency
Column Comment.58: LOW FREQUENCY FREQUENCY: setting of the instrument in Hz
Column Comment.59: LOW FREQUENCY SLOPE: attenuation of the low frequency
Column Comment.60: SEISMIC RECORDING INSTRUMENTS MAKE: make and model of the equipmentused.
Column Comment.61: RECORDING NEAR SURFACE CORRECTION: correction applied to account forvariations in surface elevation.
Column Comment.62: RECORDING NEAR SURFACE CORRECTION ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:The units of measure used during initial data acquisition, whether in feet, meters etc.
Column Comment.63: NOTCH FILTER FREQUENCY: setting of the filter in Hz
Column Comment.64: NOTCH FILTER INDICATOR: Whether the special purpose filter is in or out (Y=in,N=OUT).
Column Comment.65: POLARITY: convention used in recording, may be normal or reverse
Column Comment.66: RECORD LENGTH: The length of the recorded record for each shot
Column Comment.67: RECORD LENGTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure usedduring initial data acquisition, usually seconds
Column Comment.68: SAMPLE RATE: The interval between field data samples
Column Comment.69: SAMPLE RATE ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure used duringinitial data acquisition, usually milliseconds
Column Comment.70: RECEIVER LINE SPACING: Nominal spacing of receiver line
Column Comment.71: RECEIVER LINE SPACING ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measureused during initial data acquisition.
Column Comment.72: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.73: REPORTED WATER ACOUSTIC VELOCITY: the average acoustic velocity fromsurface to sea bed near the survey site as reported by the seismic contractor.
Column Comment.75: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.76: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.77: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.78: SOURCE DIRECTION: Azimuth direction of the signal source from the wellbore.Identifies the bearing of the surface source location from the well.
Column Comment.79: SURVEY SOURCE NORTH DIRECTION: Reference North for the bearing of thesurface source location from the well (i.e. value in Energy Source Direction).
Column Comment.80: SOURCE OFFSET: The horizontal map distance of the energy source signal fromthe well.
Column Comment.82: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.83: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.84: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.85: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.86: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.87: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.88: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
